<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Represents an allocation which has not been finalized yet.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// InFlightAllocs manage both executor memory allocations and working</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// memory allocations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// On finalization, the InFlightAlloc should transfer the content of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// working memory into executor memory, apply memory protections, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// run any finalization functions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Working memory should be kept alive at least until one of the following</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// happens: (1) the InFlightAlloc instance is destroyed, (2) the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// InFlightAlloc is abandoned, (3) finalized target memory is destroyed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If abandon is called then working memory and executor memory should both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// be freed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/jitlinkmemorymanager/inflightalloc"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/jitlinkmemorymanager/inflightalloc">InFlightAlloc</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BasicLayout simplifies the implementation of JITLinkMemoryManagers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BasicLayout groups Sections into Segments based on their memory protection</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and deallocation policies. JITLinkMemoryManagers can construct a BasicLayout</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from a Graph, and then assign working memory and addresses to each of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Segments. These addreses will be mapped back onto the Graph blocks in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the apply method.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/basiclayout"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/basiclayout/#af3fa75b45aafa6c528042df53446d8e1">BasicLayout</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The Alignment, ContentSize and ZeroFillSize of each segment will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pre-filled from the Graph. Clients must set the Addr and WorkingMem fields</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// prior to calling apply.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: The C++98 initializer is an attempt to work around compile failures</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// due to http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/cwg&#95;defects.html#1397.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We should be able to switch this back to member initialization once that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// issue is fixed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/basiclayout/segment"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/basiclayout/segment/#a89a4fe76eaba1470bab65874859dace7">Segment</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A utility class for making simple allocations using JITLinkMemoryManager.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SimpleSegementAlloc takes a mapping of AllocGroups to Segments and uses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this to create a LinkGraph with one Section (containing one Block) per</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Segment. Clients can obtain a pointer to the working memory and executor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// address of that block using the Segment&#39;s AllocGroup. Once memory has been</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// populated, clients can call finalize to finalize the memory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note: Segments with MemLifetime::NoAlloc are not permitted, since they would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// not be useful, and their presence is likely to indicate a bug.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/simplesegmentalloc"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitlink/simplesegmentalloc/#a42a424c4ae4bacccb54f2db883913ca5">SimpleSegmentAlloc</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
